dt: {bc}to swing backward and forward like a pendulum
{bc}to move or travel back and forth between two points

dt.t: he {wi}oscillates{/wi} regularly between his comfortable home … and his downtown office-laboratory

dt: {bc}to vary between opposing beliefs, feelings, or theories

dt.t: The mood of the voters has {it}oscillated{/it} between optimism and pessimism.

dt: {bc}to vary above and below a {d_link|mean|mean:3} value

pt: {sc}swing{/sc} {sc}sway{/sc} {sc}oscillate{/sc} {sc}vibrate{/sc} {sc}fluctuate{/sc} {sc}waver{/sc} {sc}undulate{/sc} mean to move from one direction to its opposite. {sc}swing{/sc} implies a movement of something attached at one end or one side.
{sc}sway{/sc} implies a slow swinging or teetering movement.
{sc}oscillate{/sc} stresses a usually regular alternation of direction.
{sc}vibrate{/sc} suggests the rapid oscillation of an elastic body under stress or impact.
{sc}fluctuate{/sc} suggests constant irregular changes of level, intensity, or value.
{sc}waver{/sc} stresses irregular motion suggestive of reeling or tottering.

et: Latin {it}oscillatus{/it}, past participle of {it}oscillare{/it} to swing, from {it}oscillum{/it} swing
shortdef: to swing backward and forward like a pendulum
to move or travel back and forth between two points
to vary between opposing beliefs, feelings, or theories
